data.author: 321thijs123
data.message:
Implemented optitrack timestamp

The message timestamp will now be the time at which optitrack acquired the data instead of the time at which the ROS node received the data

data.author: Tony Baltovski
data.message:
Merge pull request #44 from tonnesfn/master

Natnet and server version can now be set in config file

data.author: TÃ¸nnes Nygaard
data.message:
Natnet and server version can now be set in config file

Added a way to set both natnet and server version from yaml file, so you don't have to restart the broadcast each time you launch the mocap node. Add "version: [3,0,0,0]" in the optitrack_config-part of the config file

data.author: Tony Baltovski

data.author: JD Yamokoski
data.message:
Updates all source files with BSD license blurb.

Also removes std_msgs has a build dependency as its not a dependency in
the code anywhere. Cleans up package.xml to format 2, adds all authors, and
corrects maintainer.

data.author: JD Yamokoski
data.message:
Adds 2nd body to example config file

Also removes use_new_coordinates from the example config file. This is now calculated internally from the server version.

data.message: Squashing for release

data.message: Some commenting to yaml config file

data.author: Administrator
data.message: Fixed pose streaming for NaN values.

data.author: user
data.message:
Tweaking configs

 Committer: Ryan Gariepy <rgariepy@clearpathrobotics.com>

 On branch hsi-upgrades
 Changes to be committed:
   (use "git reset HEAD <file>..." to unstage)

	modified:   mocap_optitrack/config/mocap.yaml
	modified:   mocap_optitrack/src/mocap_config.cpp

data.author: user
data.message: Fixed inversion in published TF.

data.author: user
data.message: Renamed parameters to reflect the fact that tf will always be published to the same topic.

data.author: user
data.message: Fixed loop and termination code to handle SIGINT correctly.

data.author: user
data.message: Added some headers & comments.

data.author: user
data.message: Fix conversion from OptiTrack to ROS coordinate system.

data.author: user
data.message:
Check for all zeros in data. This occurs when the object is not
being tracked by Optitrack. Zero data should not result in any
pose/tf being published in ROS.

data.author: user
data.message: Simplified conversion from Optitrack to Pose2D.

data.author: user
data.message:
Cleanup and fixed uninitialized variable problems. Node now works
consistently, since variables are initialized as expected.

data.author: Alex Bencz
data.message: Some cleanup and prepare for correct mocap->ROS data conversion.

data.author: user
data.message:
Implemented multi-object support. Each object may be exposed as a
tf, Pose, or Pose2D with different topics configurable for each
rigid body & datatype.

data.author: user
data.message:
Fixed deserialization of Pose values. Code was incorrectly trying
to read position/orientation as float64 values instead of the actual
float that's in the packet.

data.author: user
data.message: Fixed remaining packet parsing bugs. Can now read multiple data sets from NatNet packets.

data.author: user
data.message: Cleaned up parsing a bit, but getting some garbage in output.

data.author: user
data.message: Fixed a bunch of stuff in OptiTrack packet parsing: crashes, memory leaks, some ugliness. Added Pose and Pose2D topics for using packages that may require these kinds of inputs. Added three parameters to enable/disable each of these topics: publish_transform, publish_pose, and publish_ground_pose.

data.author: user
data.message: Fixed memory allocation and parsing.

data.author: user
data.message: Don't launch the silly xterm.
